alert.note: Alert for Clark; Crawford (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 30 at 8:51AM CST until February 06 at 7:12PM CST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following river in Indiana... Illinois... Wabash River from Lafayette to Vincennes. .Lowland flooding continues along the Wabash River from Lafayette to Riverton, and will arrive at Vincennes Wednesday morning. The crest is currently near Clinton. Flooding is expected to continue along the lower Wabash at Riverton and Vincennes well into next week. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TUESDAY, FEBRUARY 06... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wabash River at Terre Haute. * WHEN...Until Tuesday, February 06. * IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, Pottsville Street just northwest of Terre Haute is flooded. Lowland flooding in progress with several river roads flooded in Clark County Illinois. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM EST Tuesday /8:30 AM CST Tuesday/ the stage was 21.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:30 AM EST Tuesday /8:30 AM CST Tuesday/ was 21.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 22.2 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage Tuesday, February 06. - Flood stage is 16.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued late tonight by around 100 AM EST /midnight CST/.
